DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text that describes the name of the cytology result descriptor.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information reporting the results of a cytology test.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cytology; the branch of biology that studies the structure and function of cells.

Concepts.definition: The light microscopic study of normal and abnormal cells in fine needle aspirates (FNAs), body cavity fluids, and smears.

Property.preferredDefinition: Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (ep-ih-THEE-lee-ul) Refers to the cells that line the internal and external surfaces of the body.: An abnormal increase in the number of cells in an organ or a tissue with consequent enlargement.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: The condition of being irregular or not conforming to type.

Concepts.definition: A term that refers to the cells that make up the epithelial tissues.  They are found in the skin, and in the parenchyma, surface and lumen of internal organs.
An abnormal increase in the number of cells in an organ or a tissue with consequent enlargement.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
The condition of being irregular or not conforming to type.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not severe or strong; far from extreme; not serious enough to endanger life.: The condition of being irregular or not conforming to type.

Concepts.definition: Gentle or temperate in nature or degree.
The condition of being irregular or not conforming to type.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.: The condition of being irregular or not conforming to type.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.
The condition of being irregular or not conforming to type.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intensely or extremely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality, or extent; life threatening.: The condition of being irregular or not conforming to type.

Concepts.definition: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.
The condition of being irregular or not conforming to type.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: A term applied to differences, correlations, cause-and-effect relationships, etc., to indicate that they are noticeable, probably too closely correlated to be attributed to chance and therefore indicating a systematic relation: substantial, fairly large; also having consequence or import, important in effect or meaning. In statistics significant ordinarily indicates a probability of not less than 95 percent, while highly significant indicates a probability of not less than 99 percent.: (ep-ih-THEE-lee-ul) Refers to the cells that line the internal and external surfaces of the body.: A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

In statistics significant ordinarily indicates a probability of not less than 95 percent, while highly significant indicates a probability of not less than 99 percent.
A term that refers to the cells that make up the epithelial tissues.  They are found in the skin, and in the parenchyma, surface and lumen of internal organs.
A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A malignant epithelial neoplasm which is confined to the epithelial layer without evidence of further tissue invasion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A carcinoma that is not confined to the epithelium, and has spread to the surrounding stroma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI): Transformation of a mature, normal cell or groups of mature cells to other forms of mature cells.  The capacity for malignant transformation of metaplastic cells is a subject of controversy.

Transformation of a mature, normal cell or groups of mature cells to other forms of mature cells.  The capacity for malignant transformation of metaplastic cells is a subject of controversy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic finding indicating the alteration of the glandualr acinar epithelial cells to apocrine sweat gland cells.

Concepts.definition: A morphologic finding indicating the alteration of the glandular acinar epithelial cells to apocrine sweat gland cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Failing to meet the quantitative or qualitative measures for the needs of a situation.: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Failing to meet the quantitative or qualitative measures for the needs of a situation.
